description: Standard Kubernetes/OpenShift cluster monitoring dashboard (needs Prometheus recording rules)

panels.description: "No data" means the metric is not available in this environment

targets.expr: sum by (node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="NetworkUnavailable", status!="false"} * on(node) group_left() kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})

panels.title: Nodes with unavailable Network

options.content:
- CPU / Memory capacity = total hardware resources
- CPU / Memory allocatable (brutto) = total allocatable  
- CPU / Memory allocatable (netto) = total allocatable - cpu/mem reserve - spare nodes  
  -> All requested, used and limits values are calculated with the allocatable (netto) values

targets.expr: sum by (node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="MemoryPressure", status!="false"} * on(node) group_left() kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})
sum by (node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="DiskPressure", status!="false"} * on(node) group_left() kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})
sum by (node) (kube_node_status_condition{condition="PIDPressure", status!="false"} * on(node) group_left() kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})

100
/
(
  sum(kube_node_status_allocatable:memory:sum * on(node) group_left(role) kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})
  -
  sum(kube_node_status_allocatable:memory:avg * on(node) group_left(role) topk(1,kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})) * $sparenodesfactor
)
*
sum(kube_pod_container_resource_limits:memory:running * on(node) group_left() kube_node_role{role="$noderole"})

panels.description: Not all workloads have limits defined but still use CPU resources. Thas why the usage can be higher than the limits.
panels.title: Cores Used (from LImits)

panels.description: Not all workloads have limits defined but still use CPU resources. Thas why the usage can be higher than the limits.
panels.title: Cores Used & Limits

panels.description: Not all workloads have limits defined but still use Memory resources. Thas why the usage can be higher than the limits.
panels.title: Memory Used (from Limits)

panels.description: Not all workloads have limits defined but still use Memory resources. Thas why the usage can be higher than the limits.
panels.title: Memory Used & Limits

targets.expr:
(sum(rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="iowait"}[5m])) by (instance) * on(instance) group_left(node) instance:kube_node_role{role="worker"})
/
(count(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle"}) by (instance) * on(instance) group_left(node) instance:kube_node_role{role="worker"})

panels.title: Receive Network Packets Dropped by Node
Transmit Network Packets Dropped by Node

title: Standard Cluster Monitoring
